1.speaker: OTTER
1.japanese: シロクマが おいしい季節でやんすよ
1.english: It's the season when polar bears are delicious.

2.speaker: GRIZZLY
2.japanese: お前… シロクマ　食ったこと　あんのか？
2.english: You mean to tell me that you've eaten a polar bear before?

3.speaker: OTTER
3.japanese: えぇ　今日も昼に食べましたよ
3.english: Yes, I even had one this afternoon.

6.speaker: GRIZZLY
6.japanese: カワウソが　シロクマを！？
6.english: An otter ate Polar Bear?! Impossible! You did it yourself?!

7.speaker: OTTER
7.japanese: いや　いや…　仲間と一緒に
7.english: Oh no, there was a whole group of us. A group of you ate Polar Bear?

8.speaker: GRIZZLY
8.japanese: クマ食うヤツが俺の店に来るんじゃねえ！
8.english: How dare someone who eats bears eat here! It can't be!

9.speaker: GRIZZLY
9.japanese: シロクマが あんなヤロウどもに食われるかよ！
9.english: Polar Bear would never be eaten by the likes of them!

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: 白くま　はじめました？

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: シロクマくん　ごめんね

13.speaker: PANDA
13.japanese: 僕…　今までシロクマくんのこと シロクマだと思っていたけど
13.english: All this time I thought that you were a polar bear,

14.speaker: PANDA
14.japanese: まだ　シロクマじゃなかったんだね
14.english: but I guess you weren't a polar bear yet.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: パンダくん…　何言ってるの？
15.english: What are you talking about, Panda?

16.speaker: PANDA
16.japanese: 表に　「白くま　はじめました」って
16.english: The sign out front said, "Try Our New Polar Bear."

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: だったら　今までは　ただのシロ？　ただのクマ？
18.english: So were you just white up until now? Or just a bear?

19.speaker: PENGUIN
19.japanese: 白くまっていうのはかき氷の名前だよ
19.english: No, "Polar Bear" is the name of the a shaved ice dessert.

20.speaker: PANDA
20.english: So it's shaved ice? Yes. It has condensed milk and fruits on it.

21.speaker: PENGUIN
21.japanese: なんでも　上にのせたフルーツが シロクマの顔に見えたのが由来とか
21.english: The name came from how the fruits are arranged. It looks like a polar bear's face.

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: ペンギンさんの退屈な話はいいから
22.english: I don't need your boring explanation, Mr. Penguin,

23.japanese: それ　食べてみたい！
23.english: I just want to eat it.

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: 退屈かどうかは　最後まで 聞いてから　判断してほしいね
24.english: How about listening to the whole explanation before determining that it's boring.

29.speaker: POLAR BEAR
29.japanese: しろくまカフェで　白くまを…
29.english: Eating a Polar Bear at Polar Bear's Café?

30.speaker: POLAR BEAR
30.japanese: とっても　涼しい感じ？

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.english: Yeah, really cool... Say it ain't so, Polar Bear!

32.speaker: GRIZZLY
32.japanese: ほら！　ガセだ　ガセ
32.english: See? It was a complete lie.

33.speaker: GRIZZLY
33.japanese: マジか！　マジだったのか！！

34.speaker: OTTERS
34.english: Thank you for the meal! I-It can't be!

36.speaker: GRIZZLY
36.japanese: 「はじめました」じゃねえだろ お前！

37.speaker: GRIZZLY
37.japanese: 人生 終わっちまってんじゃねえかよ！
37.english: That means your life has ended!

38.speaker: SASAKO
38.japanese: やっぱり　ムリですよ！　ハバネロは… 辛すぎます
38.english: I don't think the habaneros are a good idea. They're entirely too hot! Really? Habaneros get addicting after a while. Here I go! Over here!

39.speaker: GRIZZLY
39.japanese: シロクマ…　お前とは ガキの頃からのつきあいだったよな

40.speaker: KID
40.japanese: シロクマ…　お前とは ガキの頃からのつきあいだったよな
40.english: Go! We've been hanging out since we were kids. I wanna eat honey!

41.speaker: BABY GRIZZLY
41.japanese: 大丈夫かよ？　シロクマ！
41.english: You sure that's a good idea, Polar Bear?

42.speaker: BABY P. BEAR
42.english: You can do it! I wanna eat some smelts!

43.speaker: BABY GRIZZLY
43.japanese: 大丈夫かよ？　シロクマ…
43.english: You sure that's a good idea, Polar Bear?

45.speaker: BABY GRIZZLY
45.japanese: 大丈夫かよ？　シロクマ！
45.english: You sure that's a good idea, Polar Bear?!

46.speaker: KID
46.japanese: なんか　ろくな思い出がねえな…

47.speaker: GRIZZLY
47.japanese: なんか　ろくな思い出がねえな…
47.english: I don't... seem to have too many good memories.

48.speaker: GRIZZLY
48.japanese: とはいえ　懐かしい思い出だぜ

49.speaker: GRIZZLY
49.japanese: あぁ…　ダメだ！こうしていると お前のことばかり思い出しちまう
49.english: This ain't good. I keep thinking about you.

55.speaker: GUY2
55.japanese: 持ってきたよ　ほい

58.speaker: GRIZZLY
58.japanese: 孤独よ… 俺の悲しみを癒やしてくれ
58.english: Oh, solitude... help to sooth my sadness!

59.speaker: GIRL1
59.english: It's a bear! How cute! What are you doing?

61.speaker: PANDA
61.japanese: ねぇ　グリズリーさんのお店　ずっとお休みしてるって　ホント？
61.english: Hey, is it true that Mr. Grizzly's place has been closed for a while?

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.japanese: 旅行にでも行ってるのかも
62.english: He could be on a trip somewhere.

63.speaker: PANDA
63.japanese: 旅かぁ…　やっぱり　ワイルドな旅なんだろうね
63.english: A trip, huh? I bet it's a really wild trip.

65.speaker: POLAR BEAR
65.japanese: あてもなく　北へと向かうグリズリー
65.english: Grizzly heads aimlessly to the north.

66.speaker: POLAR BEAR
66.japanese: ふと立ち寄った居酒屋で…
66.english: He stops by a small bar.

69.speaker: FOX
69.english: It's on the house. You're traveling, aren't you?

71.speaker: FOX
71.japanese: 都会のニオイがしますよ

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.japanese: …と　そこへ現れる　人相の悪い男
72.english: And then a bad-looking man appears.

73.speaker: BAD LOOKING
73.japanese: よう　女将！ 今日も来てやったぜ
73.english: Hey there, Foxy, I decided to stop by again. Go on home! Because of you, all my other customers won't come here anymore!

74.speaker: BAD LOOKING
74.japanese: 生意気な口をきくと　タダじゃ…
74.english: Better watch your tone or else...

75.speaker: GRIZZLY
75.japanese: 出ていきな　文句があるなら 俺が相手になるぜ
75.english: Leave. If you have a problem, you'll have to deal with me.

77.speaker: FOX
77.japanese: ありがとうございます

79.speaker: POLAR BEAR
79.japanese: それがきっかけで グリズリーは居酒屋の用心棒になった
79.english: And so, Grizzly became the bar's bouncer.

80.speaker: POLAR BEAR
80.japanese: 女将の幼い子供たちも懐き…
80.english: The Fox's young children also took a liking to Grizzly.

81.speaker: CUBS
81.japanese: グリズリーおじちゃん

82.speaker: POLAR BEAR
82.japanese: 近所のお年寄りたちとも馴染み…
82.english: He also got along with the elderly in the area. Sorry for the trouble.

84.speaker: POLAR BEAR
84.japanese: いつしか　グリズリーはなくてはならない存在になっていた
84.english: Before they knew it, life was unimaginable without Grizzly. Really?

85.speaker: SASAKO
85.japanese: パンダくん　そんな　リアリティーのない話を 本気にしちゃダメだよ
85.english: Panda, you can't take stories with no sense of reality seriously.

86.speaker: GRIZZLY
86.japanese: まさか　こんな展開になるとはな
86.english: Who knew things would come to this.

87.speaker: BAD LOOKING
87.japanese: グリの兄貴も一緒にどうっすか？
87.english: How bout a cup, Mr. Griz? How 'bout some salmon {\i1}(shake){\i0} to go with that sake? Polar... Bear...

88.speaker: FOX
88.japanese: ちょっと！ ダジャレはダメだって言ったでしょ

90.speaker: GRIZZLY
90.japanese: しょせん俺たちは弱肉強食の世界を生きる者
90.english: In the end, we live in a dog-eat-dog world.

91.speaker: GRIZZLY
91.japanese: もう　俺は泣かないぜ！
91.english: I'm not gonna cry anymore! Come back anytime! Bye-bye! Take of yourself!

93.speaker: GRIZZLY
93.japanese: この店は俺が引き継ぐ！
93.english: I'm going to take over this café! What brought this on all of a sudden?

94.speaker: GRIZZLY
94.japanese: アイツの代わりが務まるのは 親友の俺しかいねえだろ
94.english: The only one that can take his place is me, his best friend.

95.speaker: GRIZZLY
95.japanese: 俺が　シロクマ始める！

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: しろくまカフェの店長やるの？
96.english: So you're gonna be the owner of Polar Bear Café?

97.speaker: GRIZZLY
97.japanese: 今日から　マスターと呼びな
97.english: Starting today, call me the manager.

98.speaker: PANDA
98.japanese: グリズリー　バーは？

99.speaker: GRIZZLY
99.japanese: やる！　昼も夜も働く！
99.english: I'll do it! I'll work day and night!

100.speaker: SASAKO
100.japanese: いつ　寝るんですか？

102.speaker: GRIZZLY
102.japanese: ダジャレだってやるぜ！ 何しろ　俺が　この店の…
102.english: I'll even make puns! Since that's what makes this place...

105.speaker: GRIZZLY
105.japanese: それじゃあ　これで　どうだ？

107.speaker: POLAR BEAR
107.english: This would be a duster {\i1}(dasuta){\i0}. Don't wipe my face with a duster!

108.speaker: GRIZZLY
108.japanese: テメエ　なんで生きてるんだよ！
108.english: Why the hell are you alive?! Because my mom gave birth to me.

110.speaker: GRIZZLY
110.japanese: お前　カワウソに食われたんじゃ！？
110.english: I thought the otters ate you!

111.speaker: OTTER
111.japanese: ちは～　今日も　白くま 食べにきたでやんす
111.english: Hey! Came by to eat the Polar Bear again. Huh?

112.speaker: GRIZZLY
112.english: What the hell is going on?!

113.speaker: GRIZZLY
113.japanese: まぎらわしい名前 つけてんじゃねえ
113.english: Y-You shouldn't have given it such a misleading name!

114.speaker: GRIZZLY
114.japanese: ったく…　驚かせやがって

115.speaker: GRIZZLY
115.japanese: 悲しみにくれた 俺の時間はいったい…
115.english: How are you going to repay the time I spent in sadne—

116.speaker: PANDA
116.japanese: 思い出すと泣いちゃうほど ショックだったの？
116.english: Was it such a shock that it brings you to tears just thinking about it?

117.speaker: GRIZZLY
117.japanese: キーン！　ってなってんだよ！

118.speaker: GUY
118.japanese: 私が仕事で その街を訪れたのは
118.english: It was on a hot summer day,

119.speaker: GUY
119.japanese: とある暑い夏の日のことだった
119.english: when my work first brought me to that town.

120.speaker: GUY
120.japanese: まとわりつく 熱気もさることながら
120.english: The thing that irritated me most

121.speaker: GUY
121.japanese: 何よりも私の心を ささくれさせたのは
121.english: in the undying heat and humidity

122.speaker: GUY
122.japanese: 昼に入った駅前の中華屋だ
122.english: was the Chinese restaurant by the station I went to for lunch.

124.speaker: GUY
124.japanese: 生ぬるい冷やし中華の麺は

125.speaker: GUY
125.japanese: みごとにのびきっていた
125.english: and had been sitting too long.

126.speaker: GUY
126.japanese: しかし　頼んだものを残すのは 私のプライドが許さない
126.english: But my pride doesn't allow me not to finish something I had ordered.

127.speaker: GUY
127.japanese: が　胃はまだもたれている
127.english: But... My stomach was still heavy.

129.speaker: GUY
129.japanese: 見知らぬ街で 見知らぬ店に入るのは
129.english: There are a lot of risks in going into an unknown café

130.speaker: GUY
130.japanese: 当たりハズレが大きい
130.english: in an unknown town. I feel alive again!

131.speaker: SASAKO
131.japanese: いらっしゃいませ お好きな席へどうぞ
131.english: Welcome! Please sit anywhere you'd like.

133.speaker: SASAKO
133.english: Oh, that's Mr. Polar Bear. Yes, I can see that.

135.speaker: GUY
135.japanese: シロクマが　店長なんですか
135.english: A polar bear is the owner?

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.japanese: ええ　しろくまカフェですから
136.english: Indeed. It is Polar Bear's Café, after all.

139.speaker: POLAR BEAR
139.japanese: お決まりの頃 おうかがいします
139.english: I'll be happy to take your order whenever you're ready. T-Thank you.

140.speaker: GUY
140.japanese: チャックなどは見つからない

141.speaker: GUY
141.japanese: やはり着ぐるみではなく本物
141.english: Apparently, it's not a costume, but rather the real deal.

142.speaker: GUY
142.japanese: この街は 動物が多いと聞いていたが
142.english: I heard that there were a lot of animals in this town,

143.speaker: GUY
143.japanese: こうして 働く動物を見たのは初めてだ
143.english: but this is the first time I've seen a working animal.

144.speaker: GUY
144.japanese: 大きい　あんな手で 料理をするのだろうか
144.english: It's huge... Does he cook with those huge hands?

145.speaker: GUY
145.japanese: カフェなのに輪切り　ありえない
145.english: Cutting fish into round slices at a café? Inconceivable!

146.speaker: GUY
146.japanese: でも　そんな想像しかできない
146.english: But that's all I can think of.

147.speaker: GUY
147.japanese: ムダがなく　しかも美しい動き

149.speaker: GUY
149.japanese: さぁ　もはや偏見は捨てて　注文するぞ
149.english: Now, I'm going to throw away any prejudices and order.

150.speaker: GUY
150.japanese: メニューが動物用だなんてことは…
150.english: What if the menu's only for animals?! Oh, it's rather normal.

152.speaker: GUY
152.japanese: いや待て　もしかすると 竹をモチーフにしたスイーツかもしれん
152.english: Wait a minute, it could just mean some dessert made to look like bamboo.

153.speaker: GUY
153.japanese: しかし　正真正銘の 竹であることも否定できない
153.english: But I can't rule out the possibility that it's actually bamboo...

155.speaker: GUY
155.japanese: あ　えっと…　アイスコーヒー

156.speaker: SASAKO
156.japanese: アイスコーヒーを おひとつでよろしいですか
156.english: Does one iced coffee complete your order?

161.speaker: SASAKO
161.english: We have a larger serving, if you'd like. What?!

164.speaker: GUY
164.japanese: 注文してしまった しかも大盛り
164.english: I ended up ordering it. And I made it a larger serving!

165.speaker: GUY
165.japanese: この選択　吉と出るか 凶と出るか
165.english: Will this decision turn out good or bad?

168.speaker: GUY
168.japanese: あ　いや待て　今まで 食べる機会がなかっただけで
168.english: Wait a sec. Maybe it's just no one's ever tried to eat it before and it's actually pretty good. Yeah, that's gotta be it!

169.speaker: GUY
169.japanese: 竹の香りが だんだんと青臭さに変わり
169.english: The bamboo aroma is slowly turning bitter

170.speaker: GUY
170.japanese: 噛み切れない筋とともに 口の中に広がってくる
170.english: and filling my mouth, along with the fibers that I can't chew through.

171.speaker: GUY
171.japanese: やっぱ　ただの竹だ

172.speaker: GUY
172.japanese: どうする こっそり出しちゃおうか
172.english: What am I going to do? Should I just quietly spit it out?

173.speaker: GUY
173.japanese: しかし　一度口に入れたものを 出すなど　言語道断
173.english: But it's unthinkable to spit out something I've already put in my mouth.

174.speaker: GUY
174.japanese: う～　だが意識が飲み込めと 命令しても体が拒否する
174.english: But even if I try to will myself to eat it, my body is resisting!

175.speaker: GUY
175.english: Water! I need water! Oh, no! I drank it all earlier!

177.speaker: SASAKO
177.english: Here's your iced coffee. Saved from above! The battle has only begun...

181.speaker: GUY
181.english: It's a panda. I saw just the head of a panda once, when I went to the zoo as a kid...

182.speaker: GUY
182.japanese: 今まさにこんな近くに
182.english: and now one is sitting right next to me!

183.speaker: GUY
183.japanese: しかし至近距離過ぎて 見るのが気まずい
183.english: But he's sitting so close that it'd be awkward to look!

185.speaker: GUY
185.japanese: そうだ　まわりを見るふりして
185.english: I know! I'll pretend I'm looking around.

186.speaker: GUY
186.japanese: えっと…　お手洗いはどっちかな
186.english: U-Um, I wonder where the bathroom is...

187.speaker: GUY
187.japanese: 見られてる パンダにメッチャ見られてる
187.english: He's staring at me! The panda is totally staring at me!

188.speaker: PANDA
188.english: Aren't you going to eat that?

190.speaker: PANDA
190.japanese: もらってあげてもいいよ
190.english: I'll take it off your hands if you want.

191.speaker: GUY
191.japanese: このチャンスを逃してはならぬ
191.english: I can't let this chance slip by.

192.speaker: GUY
192.japanese: よ…　よかったら どうぞ

195.speaker: POLAR BEAR
195.japanese: なんだか　すみませんね

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.japanese: よろしかったら　どうぞ　サービスです
197.english: Here, you can have another. It's on the house. I'm right back where I started. Welcome.

200.speaker: GUY
200.english: It's so cute. Does it plan to sit on that stool?!

201.speaker: GUY
201.japanese: よじ登るのか？　跳ぶのか？ 誰かにのせてもらうのか？
201.english: Is he going to climb up? Fly up? Is someone going to lift him up?

202.speaker: POLAR BEAR
202.japanese: コーヒー　おかわり　いかがです？
202.english: Would you like a refill on your coffee? Th-Thank you very much. Damn it! I missed it!

204.speaker: PANDA
204.japanese: ホント　仕事場にもクーラー欲しいよ
204.english: I know. I want an air conditioner {\i1}(ku-ra){\i0} at work, too. Those would be curlers {\i1}(ka-ra){\i0}.

205.speaker: PENGUIN
205.english: That would be sailor {\i1}(se-ra){\i0} style uniform.

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.japanese: それは　ディーラー

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: マーラー？　トレーラー？

216.speaker: GUY
216.japanese: 言いたい… 言ってしまいたい…
216.english: I want to say it! I really want to say it! But I can't just butt into the conversation...

219.speaker: PANDA
219.japanese: じゃあ　ブロイラー！

220.speaker: GUY
220.english: So far! I can't hold it any longer! I'll say it, no matter what they may think of me!

223.speaker: GUY
223.japanese: これまた　動物園のアイドル　コアラ！
223.english: Another idol from the zoo, the koala!

225.speaker: GUY
225.japanese: マンドリル　色　鮮やか！

226.speaker: GUY
226.english: A camel? A donkey? No... A tama? No, but it's something like that...

227.speaker: GUY
227.japanese: ああ　思い出せない…　クソ！

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.japanese: いらっしゃい　ラマさん

229.speaker: GUY
229.english: That's it! It's a llama! I feel so much better!

230.speaker: MANDRILL
230.japanese: そういえば　この前の 半田さん　おもしろかったよね
230.english: Mr. Handa was really funny the other day. {\a6}He was, it was rather impressive.

231.speaker: GUY
231.japanese: 気がついたら　私以外 周りは　みんな動物
231.english: Suddenly, I'm completely surrounded by animals... {\a6}Mr. Penguin was impressive himself.

232.speaker: KOALA
232.japanese: しかも　みんな　常連風だ
232.english: {\a6}Who knew Mr. Handa had that side to him?

233.speaker: GUY
233.japanese: しかも　みんな　常連風だ
233.english: Not to mention they all seem to be regulars... {\a6}I know!

235.speaker: ANTEATER
235.japanese: せ…　席が　いっぱいだよ

236.speaker: POLAR BEAR
236.japanese: テーブル席は空いてるよ

237.speaker: GUY
237.japanese: あ…　あの…　よかったら　どうぞ
237.english: U-Um... You can have my seat.

238.speaker: GUY
238.english: I'm about to head out, so... What? You're already going home? You should stay a while longer.

239.speaker: PENGUIN
239.japanese: いつの間に仲よくなったの？
239.english: When did you two get so close?

240.speaker: PANDA
240.japanese: ネクタイさんとは 竹をもらった仲だよ
240.english: Mr. Necktie gave me his bamboo.

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.japanese: ありがとうございました

246.speaker: SASAKO
246.japanese: お持ち帰りできますので　どうぞ
246.english: You can get it to go, so here you go. Thank you very much.

247.speaker: GUY
247.japanese: さて…　あと　ひと仕事　頑張るか
247.english: Now, then... Guess I'll get back to work. And so I worked until the sun set,

248.speaker: GUY
248.english: and welcomed night in this town.

250.speaker: GRIZZLY
250.japanese: おう　そこは空いてるぜ　座んな
250.english: That spot there's open. Have a seat.

252.speaker: GRIZZLY
252.japanese: 座れって　遠慮すんな
252.english: Sit down. There's no need to hold back.

253.speaker: GUY
253.japanese: 見知らぬ店に入るのは
253.english: There are a lot of risks

254.speaker: GUY
254.japanese: 当たりはずれが　とても大きい
254.english: in going into an unknown shop...

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: パンダ君　パンダ君

256.speaker: PANDA
256.english: What is it, Mr. Penguin? I'm always on the receiving end, so I thought I'd strike first.

258.speaker: PANDA
258.japanese: そんなことより　見てよ　ラマさんの変わり果てた姿
258.english: More importantly, look at what Mr. Llama has become.

259.speaker: PENGUIN
259.japanese: 君の辞書には　僕の話を聞くという言葉はないのかな
259.english: Does listening to me not exist in your dictionary?

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: 終わろ　しろくま君

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: 次回　しろくまカフェ
261.english: Next time on Polar Bear's Café,

262.speaker: POLAR BEAR
262.japanese: さよならペンギンさんをお送りします

263.speaker: PENGUIN
263.japanese: いるよ　ずっといるよ
263.english: Wait, I'm still here! I'll always be here!
